data.title: Crash when backspace
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.5.3 (5be4091987a98e3870d89d630eb87be6d9bafd27, 2016-09-22T08:50:42.185Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.14393

Steps to Reproduce:
1. type this code `count = 'üèÜüèÖü•á';`
2. the third one will show as square box (on Windows 10 AU) press backspace to delete the third emoji require 2 times of backspace. But the app crash when I press the 3rd times of backspace to delete the second emoji.

data.title: Failed to terminate running task, and VS Code is prevented from restarting/reloading
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.5.3
- OS Version: Windows 10 Build 14926

Seems to be different from #4684.

I am experiencing this issue on both of my laptops with different projects, it is quite annoying because it even blocks me from restarting/reloading VS Code itself.

This is my `tasks.json` configuration, using TypeScript 2.0:

``` json
{
    "version": "0.1.0",
    "command": "npm",
    "isShellCommand": true,
    "args": ["run", "build", "--", "-w"],
    "showOutput": "silent",
    "isWatching": true,
    "problemMatcher": "$tsc-watch"
}
```

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Execute build command.
2. Execute terminate running task command or just try to close/reload VS Code.

data.title: Extension View icon shows outdated but no extensions are outdated.
data.body:
- VSCode Version:1.6 insiders
- OS Version:Windows 10

Note: This is a recent regression and only showed up with the latest insiders build. d81ee41c51cae93a5cac967e42a28660a3a7e005

Steps to Reproduce:
1. With just two extensions installed (DavidAnson.vscode-markdownlint-0.5.0 and seanmcbreen.Spell-0.8.6), look at Extension View icon

![outdatedext](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/12818376/18793708/e5378d12-8170-11e6-96ef-ecf512a77a11.png)

The "Show Outdated Extensions" query also doesn't show any results. 

The installed extension versions match the latest Marketplace versions.

data.title: VS Code Linux Terminal won't scroll with PowerShell
data.body:
**System Details**
- VSCode Version: 1.5.3
- OS Version: Ubuntu 16.04.1 LTS Desktop
- PowerShell: v6.0.0-alpha.10

**Issue Description**

Just discover, when executing PowerShell with Integrated Terminal, it won't scroll Up/Down.  When it's using BASH is working fine.

**Steps to Reproduce:**
1. Go to Integrated Terminal (ctrl-`)
2. in Bash, type powershell
3. run dir multiple times
4. Try to scroll up.

Note: even when using "terminal.integrated.shell.linux":"/opt/microsoft/powershell/6.0.0-alpha.10/powershell",

![vscodeterminalbug](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/19892435/18790473/e41305fe-817c-11e6-8926-e6f36220dc5f.png)

data.title: QuickFix (context menu) is losing focus (closing) automatically
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.5.3
- OS Version: Windows 10 AU
- Tested in C# code

Steps to Reproduce: 
1. Open QuickFix (Ctrl + .) right after a code is marked with red squiggly line.
2. Navigate between context options with arrows (the problem occour even without navigation).
3. Suddenly the context menu closes.

The problem don't occour if you wait a few seconds before open context menu.

[bug]

data.title: Issues with "Open new window" in vs code

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open a project in visual studio code 
2. cmd + shift + n (to open new window)
3. after ~4seconds an error "toast" is shown saying. "Extension host terminated unexcpectedly. Please reload the window to recover. " 
4. Pressing reload window will repeat the error.

data.title: Test: icons show up everywhere
data.body:
Test for #11751:
- [x] Windows - @joaomoreno 
- [x] OS X - @ramya-rao-a 
- [x] Linux - @roblourens 

Complexity: 3

If an icon theme is enabled, we now show icons in a lot more places. Please verify for:
- themes that use an icon font (e.g. Seti)
- themes that use icons as PNGs (e.g. VSCode Icons)

Verify the icons show up properly in these places:
- explorer
- opened editors
- search
- problems
- editors (when tabs are enabled AND disabled)
- quick open

Verify you can set a setting to disable icons for editors. There is currently no other setting to configure icons for the other viewers.

Verify that the icons update live when
- you change file associations in settings
- you create a new file or rename an existing file in the explorer and type the name and extension

data.title: Show list of builtin extensions in the sidebar

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body: Builtin extensions don't show up in the sidebar by default unless you search for them - which is good, because it should only show user-installed extensions at first. But it might be useful to browse a list of the builtin extensions, for discoverability, and to emphasize that vscode is an extensible editor that happens to ship with a set of extensions enabled by default. Only a couple will show up at the moment but I understand we plan to move the rest of our extensions to this  model where they live in the marketplace.

complexity: 2 bananas (out of 5 fruits)

Use the dev tools to control when to show the `New version` message at startup:

The release notes now show in-product. Make sure they look OK and display images. If for any reason they fail to load, a browser window should open to the release notes link, just as before.

data.title: Test: Electron Update 1.3.x
data.body:
Test for #10206:
- [x] Windows - @mousetraps 
- [x] OS X El Capitan - @kieferrm
- [x] OS X Sierra - @isidorn
- [x] Linux - @mjbvz 

Complexity: 4

We have updated Electron to version 1.3.x and thereby jumped 3 chrome releases and one major node.js version. This test item asks for exploratory testing focusing on native integration where possible:
- drag and drop
- menus and context menus
- window management and multiple windows
- UI regressions
- accessibility regressions

**Windows**: since we lost the ability to see output on the console and need to add our own helper utility to see output, please play around with code from the command line and verify you can see output for the various command line options we provide.

data.title: Feature request: Copy reference/relative path
data.body:
Pretty useful and implemented in IDEs like IntelliJ IDEA: ability to **copy reference/relative path** to the file in project tree, or to current line/definition in editor.

At this point there's a "Copy Path" menu item, which is pretty useless to me, always have to paste it, modify and then send to colleagues.

What I expect is actually a path like `src/app.js` instead of `/Users/.../Repo/.../src/app.js`. And `src/app.js:123` when copied from editor, pointing to specific line.

Mostly switched to VSCode, so hope it'll be even more convenient.
Thanks!

data.title: Should provide option for "Set next statement" to set the current debug point.

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body: Should be able to set the current statement to execute when in the debugger from the context menu like you can do in Visual Studio. This allows you to skip code that you don't want to execute which is often valuable when it is time consuming to have to change the code, maybe rebuild and restart the debugger. Would go nicely with [4993](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/4993).

data.title: Small formatting issue in TSX file
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.5.3
- OS Version: Win10

Steps to Reproduce:

This JSX:

```
<select>
    <option value="1">Q1. Jan - Mar</option>
    <option value="2">Q2. Apr - Jun</option>
    <option value="3">Q3. Jul - Sep</option>
    <option value="4">Q4. Oct - Dec</option>
</select>
```

Auto formats to (note the missing spaces after the .'s):

```
<select>
    <option value="1">Q1.Jan - Mar</option>
    <option value="2">Q2.Apr - Jun</option>
    <option value="3">Q3.Jul - Sep</option>
    <option value="4">Q4.Oct - Dec</option>
</select>
```

This error only seems to occur when the file is saved as tsx. Setting the language mode to typescript react isn't enough.
